questions.question: In which situations are you forced to give way?

options.text: At an undirected intersection, when you enter a national road, coming from a county road
When meeting pedestrians who are on the opposite direction of travel.

questions.question: What obligations do you have when meeting the indicator “Animals”?

options.text: To reduce speed at the signal of people accompany animals
Drive carefully, and, if necessary, reduce speed
You have no obligation, as the indicator is addressed to persons accompanying animals.

questions.question: You can cross over a continuous line with the vehicle if:

options.text: The continuous line is accompanied by a discontinuous one, closer to your direction of travel
They are applied on roads with more than one lane on each direction of travel
It separates the traffic lanes in opposite directions.

questions.question: The marking applied on the right edge of the roadway, consisting of a zigzag line:
The ending zone where stopping was banned is announced by:

options.text: Indicator 2, followed by the additional panel.

questions.question: Which of the two indicators signals a mandatory change of direction to the right, after crossing the place where it is installed?
Which of these signs announces the end of a priority road?
This indicator means:

options.text: Priority of circulation from opposite direction .

questions.question: What vehicles are you allowed to overtake in the given situation?

options.text: Animal-drawn vehicles, bicycles and motorcycles without sidecar
Cars, motorcycles without sidecar and animal-drawn vehicles
Motor vehicles except motorcycles without sidecar.

questions.question: Which of these indicators obliges you to change direction to the right?
The indicator warns that:

options.text: The road follows a tram station with pedestrian platform
The road meets a railway crossing without barriers or semi-barriers, with automated signaling.

questions.question: What is the significance of this indicator?

options.text: Forbidden entry for vehicles carrying hazardous substances that can pollute waters.

questions.question: The indicator informs you about:

options.text: A special place where you can take a break and rest.

questions.question: The significance of a road sign installed above a lane is applicable:

options.text: Only for the lane on top of which it is installed
For the full width of the carriageway.

questions.question: What is the significance of the longitudinal marking applied as a continuous line on the axis of roads?
What should you do when you are behind a tram stopped at a station, which has not platform for pedestrians?

options.text: To stop in front of the last door
To stop behind the tram and resume driving only after the tram doors have closed
To stop at a distance of 25 m from the tram.

questions.question: In which of the situations is stopping prohibited?

options.text: In the action area of the indicator “Prohibition to overtake”
Beside another vehicle which is stopped, if it is disturbing the movement of two vehicles coming from the opposite directions.

questions.question: Is it allowed to cross over the longitudinal marking of a continuous and a discontinuous line?

options.text: Yes, if the marking is not in a curve
Yes, if the discontinuous line is the one nearest to the direction of travel
Yes, if the discontinuous line is on the other side of the continuous line.

questions.question: What is the significance of the indicator accompanied by the additional panel?

options.text: Marks the end of the area where it is forbidden to stop
Marks the beginning of the area where it is forbidden to stop
Marks the beginning of the area where stationing (parking) is forbidden.

questions.question: Which of the following signs indicates a one-way road?
What should you do when you meet this indicator?

options.text: Register that it signals entry into a curve
Reduce speed and drive carefully, because you are entering a particularly dangerous curve
Sound the horn and enter the curve.

questions.question: What should you do when you come across this indicator?

options.text: Stop, without exceeding the corner of the intersection, ensure and grant priority to all vehicles
Reduce speed, ensure, and if at that time other vehicles travel on the priority road, stop to give way
Ensure to left and right and then continue on the road.

questions.question: This indicator signals:

options.text: You have the right of way over vehicles traveling from the opposite direction
You must give way to vehicles traveling from the opposite direction.

questions.question: What is the significance of this indicator?

options.text: Priority for vehicles coming from the front
Access for all vehicles is banned

questions.question: What is the significance of these panels?
What will you respect at this crossroad?

options.text: The indication of the traffic light

questions.question: On meeting this indicator, you have to:

options.text: Travel with caution, because at a distance of 50 m is an intersection with a priority road
You have no obligation, because you are travelling on a priority road
Grant right priority at the next indicator.

questions.question: At which indicator do you have right of way?

options.text: “Priority over traffic from the opposite direction"
“Priority for traffic from the opposite direction. "

questions.question: What is the significance of the continuous longitudinal marking?

options.text: It directs drivers in conditions of poor visibility
It prohibits overtaking on the sector it is applied.

questions.question: What is the role of resonator markings?

options.text: To double the conventional markings in hazardous areas
To warn drivers that they exceed the marked roadway
To warn motorists that they are about enter an area monitored by radar.

questions.question: Which indicator will appear at the intersection located 100 m from the first indicator?
Which vehicle passes through the intersection first?
What is the significance of this indicator?
What is the significance of this road marking?
Should you respect the significance of indicators installed on the left side of the road, facing drivers approaching?

options.text: No, because it addresses drivers from the opposite direction
Yes, but only those who travel on the lane nearest to the road axis
Yes, all drivers of vehicles who meet the indicator.

questions.question: Where do you see this indicator?

options.text: At the beginning of road sectors covered by snow or ice

questions.question: On meeting this indicator you will be required:

options.text: To drive carefully on the narrow road
To give way only to trucks and buses that travel in the opposite direction
To give way to vehicles traveling in the opposite direction.

questions.question: In this situation you will not:
Which of these signs is addressed to vehicle drivers?
The indicator and its additional panel mean that:

options.text: Stopping is allowed for not more than 30 minutes
Stationing (parking) is allowed for not more than 30 minutes.

questions.question: What is the significance of the road marking?
The indicator warns you about:

options.text: A sequence of curves over a distance of 1.5 km, with the first to the left
A sequence of curves on a hill, at a distance of 1.5 km from the indicator, with the first to the right
A double curve, first to the right, at a distance of 1.5 km from the indicator.

questions.question: What is the significance of the indicator?

options.text: Obliges to circumvent from the right, the place where it is installed
Obliges to change direction to the right
Obliges to use the lane near the sidewalk.

questions.question: Are you allowed to drive on the lane opposite to the direction of travel, over such a road marking?
At unmarked intersections, drivers who want to drive forward will occupy:
Which right of way rule is applicable when meeting this indicator?

options.text: The one who has reached the intersection first

questions.question: The panel below the indicator allows:

options.text: Standing (parking) of public transport vehicles during the time interval mentioned
Standing (parking) outside the time frame mentioned.

questions.question: At which of the indicators is turning (U-turn) allowed?
Which indicator does not allow the change of direction to the right or left?
Are you obliged to respect the significance of an indicator located on the left side of the road?

options.text: Yes, but only if there are works on the road, in your driving direction
Yes, because their significance is for your direction of travel
No, because they are meant for traffic from the opposite direction.

questions.question: What information does this indicator provide?

options.text: Indicates a road open to international traffic
Bans cars from entering a city and indicates the route to bypass it
Indicates a route to bypass the locality.

questions.question: What is the significance of the indicator?
How will you cross an intersection if you meet indicator “Give way”?

options.text: Reduce speed, only when a vehicle is approaching
Reduce speed, ensure, and if other vehicles are passing on the transversal road, stop to grant them the right of way
Reduce speed and ensure, to give way to vehicles that drive from the right side.

questions.question: In this roundabout you are properly placed for:
How do you proceed in this situation?

options.text: You grant priority for the truck to pass
You reduce speed and signal with the lights

questions.question: How will you proceed on meeting this indicator?

options.text: Drive carefully, as an intersection with a priority road follows in 300 m
Reduce speed, ensure and give way to all vehicles traveling on a distance of 300 m
Drive carefully, in order to stop safely in a maximum of 300 m.

questions.questionsNumber: 57 In this situation, you have to:
questions.question: In this situation, you have to:

options.text: Bypass the indicator from the right
Bypass the indicator from the left
Go forward in the first intersection.

questions.question: In what sequence will vehicles pass through the intersection?
What is the meaning of this indicator?

options.text: Area where the recommended speed is 30 km/h
Area where circulation below 30 km/h is restricted
Area where vehicles transporting goods are forbidden to travel with more than 30 km/h.

questions.question: Is it forbidden to park along the continuous longitudinal mark separating the directions of traffic?

options.text: Yes, when other drivers are required to cross over that mark

questions.question: In this situation, you are forbidden:

options.text: To bypass an obstacle from the left.

questions.question: What is the significance of this indicator?
What are the obligations of drivers when meeting this sign?

options.text: To give way to vehicles driving in the intersection
To bypass the center of the intersection and drive closer to the edge of the street

questions.question: The interdiction of this indicator addresses:

options.text: All vehicles except motorcycles without sidecars

questions.question: The indicator warns of:

options.text: A speed breaker where the speed limit is 30 km/h.

questions.question: In what situations are you permitted to cross the continuous longitudinal marking on the axis of the road?

options.text: When it consists of a single line
When the continuous line is accompanied by a discontinuous one, placed on the side of the driver
When the road is straight and visibility in front is clear.

questions.question: Which of the indicators grants the right of way?
What does the indicator mean?

options.text: Follows a road sector with works on the carriageway
Follows a road sector with the danger of loose gravel
Pre-signaling a road section with alternating traffic.

questions.question: The indicator does not grant access to:

options.text: Cars, motorcycles without sidecar and animal-drawn vehicles
Cars, motorcycles and vehicles pushed or pulled by hand.

questions.question: This indicator warns of:
The indicator obliges you:

options.text: To drive straight or right at the first intersection
To turn left, because access is denied in other directions
To follow the detour route, pre-signaled to the right.

questions.question: The indicator prohibits:
What does the indicator mean?
The continuous longitudinal marking on the axis of the road, can be crossed:

options.text: Only by the drivers of motorcycles and mopeds

questions.question: In this situation:

options.text: You will drive with caution until the first intersection
You will drive at a maximum of 30 km/h on the uneven road
You will drive at a speed of at least 30 km/h.

questions.question: In this case you will stop:

options.text: Behind the car in front of you
